it.uniba.game

Class Match

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.uniba.game.Match

  • public final class Match
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a chess match
    Class type : < Control >

    Responsibilities :
    Knows :
    • The current status of the ChessBoard
    • Captured pieces by each player
    • The history of the moves
    • The current player
    • The last long move done by a pawn
    Does :
    • Parsifies the move given an input string
    • Establishes whether the move is a Castling, a Capture or a simple one
    • Checks whether the established move is legal and not ambiguous
    • Executes the move, if legal
    • Updates the status of Rooks and Kings in order to say if the former can be captured en passant, or the latter can execute Castling
    • Records the captures done by the players
    • Updates the color of the current player according to the flow of the game
    Author:
    LeCun group

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Match()
      Constructor of the class Match It initializes the currentPlayer to WHITE and creates a new ChessBoard with the pieces at the initial position of a classic chess game.

    • Method Detail

      • inputMove

        public void inputMove(java.lang.String toParse)
               throws it.uniba.game.MatchException
        Method used to execute a move entered by a player.
        The move must be entered in correct Italian algebraic notation. It checks whether the passed move is a castling, a normal move or a capture. If a move is legal, it will be added to the history of the moves, if it is a capture, the captured piece will be added to the list of captures. Eventually, it will flag the rooks and the king as "moved" (not capable of a castling).
        Parameters:
        toParse - Player move represented as a string.
        Throws:
        it.uniba.game.MatchException - Raised if the user tries to enter an irregular or incorrect move.

      • getPrintableCaptures

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public void nextTurn()
